results.title: Ouyen's Roxy Theatre
results.creator_credit: David Withers, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: The Roxy Theatre in Ouyen was under threat of becoming an abandoned ruin until the community stepped in to save it. Originally opened in 1936, it eventually became one of the only tropical theatres in the southern region of Australia but was closed in 1971 due to the actions of rowdy youths (according to local myth). After 36 years of closure, Jenny Heaslip took on the challenge of restoring the theatre and rallied over 250 local volunteers to help her. It is now an integral meeting point for the people of Ouyen not only because of fortnightly film screenings, but for community events, launches and celebrations. Run on a shoestring budget The Roxy continues to rely upon volunteers and community fundraising to stay alive.

results.title: The Sinking home
results.creator_credit: Cameron Sugden, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Cam Sugden pays tribute to Mary, the matriarch of a poor Phillippino household in Manila. Despite living in a slum, Mary has endeavoured to create a large cocoon to protect her family. Created as part of an ACMI Digital Storytelling Program in the Digital Studio or outreach program.

results.title: Tale of two cities
results.creator_credit: Ralph Thomas, Betty E. Box and Rank Film Productions
results.brief_description: An adaptation of Charles Dickens’ immortal tale of romance and intrigue set against the lurid background of the French Revolution. Dirk Bogarde stars as Sydney Carlton whose final act of self-sacrifice brings the story to its dramatic end. Also stars Dorothy Tutin and Cecil Parker, Leo McKern, Christopher Lee and Donald Pleasence.

results.title: People in red hats
results.creator_credit: Jane Curtis, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Jane Curtis reflects on how she spent her childhood sitting in the loungeroom of her grandparents home. As her family spoke in a language she didn’t understand, Curtis was transfixed by the painting that hung on her grandparent’s wall. Only as an adult would she discover the mysteries that painting held. Created as part of an ACMI Digital Storytelling Program in the Digital Studio or outreach program.

results.title: Tale of one city
results.creator_credit: Zoran Janjic, Peter Johnson, Department of Housing, Environment and Community Development and Film Australia
results.brief_description: This film uses animation in a light-hearted manner to show some of the problems of living in a modern city, the need for more careful urban planning to help alleviate these problems, and the way in which pressure groups have an important influence on the town planners.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Zoran Janjic, Peter Johnson, Department of Housing, Environment and Community Development and Film Australia

results.title: Sustainable Ouyen
results.creator_credit: David Withers, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: Several years ago a group of Ouyen Primary School students petitioned their local council to adopt a community-recycling program. To everybody’s surprise the council not only provided an unprecedented household recycling service but did so at a loss. Since that time the community has launched a number of forward thinking initiatives with solar power, sustainable agriculture and improved water usage. Whether it’s the Ouyen Football Club, High School or local farmers, there’s an understanding that sustainable practices must be employed now in order for future Ouyen generations to benefit.

results.title: Family treasures
results.creator_credit: Penny Morison, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Penny Morison provides a sensorial experience as she recalls her many holidays spent at the family holiday home in Aireys Inlet, on the south-west coast of Victoria. Run by her aunt, the holiday home has provided countless Summer memories for Penny as she was growing up and for future generations.
